actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend section 319(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide that spouses of members of the Armed Forces of the United States need not petition for naturalization in a State in which they have resided for six months.

summary.text: Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide that spouses of United States citizen members of the Armed Forces need not reside in a State for at least six months in order to petition for naturalization.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 319(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide that spouses of members of the Armed Forces of the United States need not petition for naturalization in a State in which they have resided for six months.
